item.title: NYT Connections Hints Today (#881)—Clues and Answers for Saturday, November 8
item.content:encoded:
It’s the weekend, but don’t feel like you can relax until you’ve completed today’s NYT Connections puzzle! I’ve got the solutions and NYT Connections hints you need to dominate today’s puzzle, which happens to be pretty tricky. Before you roll into your weekend, scroll down and get the answers I know you’re looking for.

NYT Connections hints await!

What is NYT Connections?

It would be remiss of me not to give a little foundational backstory before leaping into today’s NYT Connections clues and hints.

In June 2023, NYT Connections emerged as yet another game in the ever-growing New York Times lineup. This title soared immediately, and it’s easy to see why. As a free-to-play, accessible New York Times game, NYT Connections is available to users worldwide and can be played on either desktop devices or via a mobile app.

Playing NYT Connections on your commute or while waiting for a coffee is a fantastic way to kill a few minutes.

But how do you play NYT Connections?

It’s relatively simple, and that’s why it’s the best New York Times game, in my opinion.

The NYT team will provide you with a grid of 16 words once a day. The only task left up to you is to sort those words into four groups of four by finding their commonalities. Every NYT Connections puzzle has just one solution, and some words might have a double meaning, so it can sometimes be tricky to figure out the answers.

It’s also important to stress that the words are color-coded: yellow, blue, green, and purple. That’s in order of difficulty from least to most difficult, too.

What’s critical here is that you get four guesses every day, and if you use those, your NYT Connections answers for today will be out of reach, as it’ll be game over.

Today’s NYT Connections Hints (November 8)

If you want to figure out today’s NYT Connections clues without getting the answers outright, I’ll start with the words themselves. Perhaps just seeing the words here will spur your brain into action, and you’ll spot the trends immediately.

Here are the NYT Connections words from today’s puzzle, #881:

  • SIGN
  • SPY
  • STOP
  • ROBOT
  • SEAL
  • BODY
  • DELIVER
  • PRESENT
  • BEAM
  • PLUG
  • PROGRAMMING
  • CHING
  • GIVE
  • SPOKEN
  • CLOSE
  • PRONOUNCE

And here are the hints I can offer for today’s NYT Connections:

  • Yellow – These all suggest obstructing or closing something
  • Green – Each word implies offering or stating something publicly
  • Blue – These are all forms or systems of communication
  • Purple – Each of these can follow “I” to form a phrase

Here’s the final warning before we get to the NYT Connections answers for today, November 8.

Are you sure you want to scroll further?

Very well!

NYT Connections Answers for Today, November 8 (#881)

If you want to jump straight to the answers for today’s NYT Connections puzzle, I’ve got you covered:

  • Yellow – CLOSE, PLUG, SEAL, STOP
  • Green – DELIVER, GIVE, PRESENT, PRONOUNCE
  • Blue – BODY, PROGRAMMING, SIGN, SPOKEN
  • Purple – BEAM, CHING, ROBOT, SPY

When Does NYT Connections Reset?

That’s today’s puzzle, but if you want the next one, the game resets daily at midnight local time (that’s your local time). You’ll have 24 hours to complete the puzzle when midnight ticks over in your timezone.

How did you do? Did you get a perfect run? Let me know what your streak looks like on the Insider Gaming Discord server

item.title: Microsoft Store Leaks Silent Hill 2 Xbox Release Date
item.content:encoded:
Silent Hill 2 finally has a release date for when it’s coming to Xbox Series X|S, and it comes from an early update on the Microsoft Store.

Though the listing has seemingly been removed, it’s been revealed—h/t True Achievements for finding it first—that Silent Hill 2 will launch on Xbox on Friday, November 21, 2025.

For those who’ve been following, an Xbox launch has long been rumored and expected. Talk even picked up more steam when the game was officially rated for Xbox by the ESRB on October 31, meaning that a launch wasn’t going to be far off.

Looking at the store listing, it says the game is optimized for both the Xbox Series X and Series S. It will also release for the console and PC via the Microsoft Store. However, there’s no official mention of it being a play anywhere title.

Silent Hill 2 first launched on PlayStation 5 (PS5) and PC via Steam on October 8, 2024. The deal for the game to be console exclusive on the PS5 was for a year, which expired early last month. As of writing, the game has a “generally favorable” rating of 86 on Metacritic from 105 reviews while the user score is even higher at 9.1 from 3,998 user ratings.

In addition to Xbox, there have also been rumors that it will be released on the Nintendo Switch 2. Whether it happens on the same date as Xbox remains to be seen, but it’s clear that those without a PC or PS5 will be getting to play the remake from Bloober Team in the very near future.

It’s worth noting, though, that neither Konami nor Bloober Team have officially announced anything yet.

Now that we seemingly have a release date, will you pick up Silent Hill 2 on Xbox?  Leave your thoughts down in the comments and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more Insider Gaming, read about what BioWare had to say about the state of the next Mass Effect game. And don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Halo Infinite Ending Support, Moving onto ‘Multiple Projects’
item.content:encoded:
Halo Infinite is ending after four years of updates, confirms Halo Studios. However, it seems the company is putting the teams on multiple new Halo projects, like Halo: Campaign Evolved.

The Halo franchise has been at the forefront of the FPS genre since its debut in 2001 on Xbox. With several entries, the series has become synonymous with gamers alike for its epic space setting and thrilling gunplay. With the 30th anniversary coming up, Halo Studios is going all in, starting with the recently-revealed Halo: Campaign Evolved, a remake of 2001’s Combat Evolved. Unfortunately, the most recent title, Halo Infinite, is ending production, but it will lead to new projects in the works.

Halo Studios Stopping Updates for Halo Infinite to Support Other Games

In a blog post from Halo Studios, the team announced that Halo Infinite’s newest update, Operation: Infinite, will be its last major one. The update, set to go live on November 18th, 2025, will include new armor, maps, challenges, and 2x XP. Unfortunately, it’s the final one for the game, as, in the blog, the team states,

“With multiple Halo titles in development, we’ll need our whole team’s combined focus to deliver new experiences with the same passion and care that our community has given us,” the blog reads. “While we remain committed to supporting Halo Infinite on the road ahead, Operation: Infinite is the last major content update currently planned.”

Fortunately, it seems the Halo Infinite team is shifting to help on other Halo games currently in the works. We only know of one, Halo: Campaign Evolved, so this does confirm more is in development at Halo Studios. There are rumors that a live-service Halo game is planning to release in 2026, so perhaps it’s one of the titles it’s working on. Of course, one can also assume the next mainline entry is in production, though no confirmation has been made for either project.

What do you think of Halo Infinite ending support? Are you excited to see what Halo Studios has in store? What game do you hope is next? Mainline? Multiplayer? Let us know in the comments and on the official Insider Gaming Discord!

For more Halo, check out how Campaign Evolved is fixing the game’s most controversial level and the cancelled MMO. Make sure to subscribe to our weekly newsletter!

SUBSCRIBE to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.

item.title: Build A Roller Coaster Codes (November 2025)
item.content:encoded:
Use these Roblox Build a Roller Coaster monthly redeem codes for November 2025 to get free rewards including cash, new tracks as well as other freebies.

As the title suggests, Build a Roller Coaster is all about constructing the most fun and immersive roller coaster ride. However, to purchase the first-class Carts and Tracks, you’ll need tons of Cash, in-game currency. Many will automatically start grinding to build the longest Roller Coaster in this enjoyable Roblox experience. You can simply redeem the highlighted active codes. The free rewards consist of free money and code-exclusive Tracks. New players and veterans can easily build colossal roller coaster rides without spending hours glued to the chair. 

Active Build A Roller Coaster Codes

  • 1mvisits – Freebies (New)
  • discordian – Climb Track
  • release – 500 Cash
  • robloxian – 1000 Cash

Inactive Build A Roller Coaster codes

Since this game is a new Roblox experience, there are no inactive codes yet. The active codes are speculated to go inactive before major in-game updates and events. If any codes expire, the same will reflect here, so stay tuned. 

How To Redeem Build A Roller Coaster Codes

Here are the steps to redeem the active codes for Build a Roller Coaster: 

  1. Start Build a Roller Coaster on Roblox. 
  2. Once inside the server, select the gear icon to open the “Settings” box.
  3. Enter any code into the “Enter Code” text box. 
  4. Finally, press the green “Enter” button to activate the code. 

Where To Find New Build A Roller Coaster Codes

Insider Gaming regularly updates this article, especially when new codes debut. To learn more about the new codes, you should join the game’s official Discord server and keep an eye on the game’s Roblox homepage. Fresh codes are usually issued during special milestones and major in-game updates. 

FAQs On Build A Roller Coaster Codes

What are the latest codes?

1mvisits is the latest active code.

Are the free rewards obtained from the active promo codes useful?

Yes, the freebies will lend a helping hand in your quest to build a monumental roller coaster ride. You can use the free money to upgrade your Tracks, Carts, Gears, and enhance your ride. 

How often do the codes expire?

As of now, there are no official expiration dates for the codes. Therefore, they might expire at any moment.

Enjoying our Roblox games codes coverage? Check out the codes for popular games like Steal A Brainrot, Radiant Residents, and Fix It Up on Insider Gaming!

item.title: Genshin Impact Developer Is Apparently Working on a Unreal Engine 5 Open World MMO Game
item.content:encoded:
According to a new teaser that has surfaced online, it appears that Genshin Impact developer miHoYo has begun work on a fantasy MMO game with AI-based elements, called Genesis, utilizing Unreal Engine 5.

miHoYo is known for its work on anime-style games, with Genshin Impact being the developer’s crown jewel. Their roster includes several other games with the same art style, such as Zenless Zone Zero and Honkai Impact 3rd, among others. Now, it seems the developer will be venturing into a new world with Unreal Engine 5 and MMO elements.

Genesis is a Fantasy MMO With AI Elements

Users on ResetEra (via Eurogamer) have spotted a video featuring a tease for Genshin Impact devs’ upcoming Unreal Engine 5 MMO title. The video was posted by miHoYo’s hiring department on the Chinese social media platform, Xiaohongshu. Through translations, it has been revealed that the game is being developed using Unreal Engine 5 and will be a fantasy MMO title featuring an Open World and PvP. miHoYo’s was previously using Unity Engine for games like Genshin Impact, Zenless Zone Zero, Honkai Star Rail and more.

Coming to the AI-based elements of the title, the translations have revealed that the title will feature “Artificial Intelligence Stimulated Eco System, All-Terrain Battle AI, and Intellectual NPC. It is difficult to determine the extent to which AI will play a role in the upcoming title, but it appears that it will be utilized in some capacity. However, as these are translations, players should treat this information with caution.

In other news, Genshin Impact has been removed from PlayStation 4, and support will end next year. Additionally, earlier this year, Congnosphere (HoYoverse) was fined $20 million for selling lootboxes to children and teenagers. What are your thoughts on Genshin Impact developer’s upcoming Unreal Engine 5-powered open world MMO game? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 Endgame details arriving next week. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.
